Reviews.Title: “I'll stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: richard b
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October,2011, for 13 days, and couldn't be happier with accomodations, and especially the helpful staff. Located about 1 km north of the main railroad station, and about 1-l/2 km east of the Borghese Gardens, this villa (built in 1900) was about 100 meters from a bus and tram stop, and a 5-to-10 minute walk to Metro stop. In a quiet, tree-lined neighborhood within walking distance of really good, economical restaurants, perfect after a long day's touring, or even a hectic day of business. Rooms called small by other reviewers were spacious by European standards, my pal and I moved around easily. Terraces were available to all, complete with chaises-longues, for relaxing in the mild Roman nights. The pricing for rooms was low compared to the dubious privilege of staying in the Centro Storico, or anywhere near it, any why bother when you are 10 to 15 minutes by taxi or bus, tram or Metro away from almost anything you want to see? The staff, again, were warm, professional and totally helpful with directions, including maps, making reservations, etc. I love Rome, and stayed downtown and near it, but I'm staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not central”
Reviews.Author: evheg
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a lovely quite neighborhood but you need to get public transport to get anywhere lovely local Italian restaurants ask for recommendations at reception overall good but a bit far out might be good for kids ad it's quite

Reviews.Title: “Definately NOT recommanded”
Reviews.Author: traveller0238
Reviews.Content: From the pictures you may think that this is a nice, good furnished hotel. Our experience however showed that this is far from true. The rooms are small (it is almost impossible to walk around the bed) and extremely hot and dark. There were no windows in our room, only an exit to the balcony. Because of the heat we had to leave the doors to the balcony open, allowing everyone to enter into the room, so this was not without a risk. The bathroom stank and the bed was very hard, making it difficult for the blood to circulate and thus causing 'sleeping' limbs. The tv set was very small (15 inch or so), making it almost impossible to watch a movie. We asked the guy at the reception desk to fix the air conditioning. Clearly irritated ty the question, he told us that in the winter it only blows hot air and the only thing that he could do was to switch it off (which he never did). The breakfast consisted of a couple of croissants, some sandwiches, orange juice and undrinkable coffee. Definitely NOT good. Furthermore there was this woman, never speaking a word and watching us every move and counting the bread each time we took some. It was as if the woman was like a ghost that could not find rest in the hereafter; knocking about in the restaurant of the hotel. We made jokes about this, but certainly, this was the most ridiculous experience we ever had (in a hotel)! There is no (internal) telephone guide and the information provided by the staff is unreliable. For example we asked at what time the first metro leaves during weekdays. We were told from 05:00 AM. As a result we found a closed metro station at 05:05 AM the day we left, because in reality the first metro leaves about 06:00 AM! The doors at the hotel are locked by a chain and a padlock during the night, making it impossible to leave the hotel in case of an emergency. So, if you are planning a trip to Rome, take care of your life (and your vacation) and DO look for another hotel and stay out of this one.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, quiet, outdoor space, small rooms, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: missmary1050
Reviews.Content: This beautiful old villa set in an area of Rome surrounded by many similar buildings is just 2 stops on the Metro from the Central Rome Railway station, followed by a walk of, I would guess, less than 1km. If you are arriving in the dark, get your directions worked out before you arrive as it can be confusing when you emerge from the subway and this area is does not invite lingering. The cost of the Metro journey was 1 Euro each, compared with the price quoted for a taxi of 25 - 30 Euros. Breakfast is included in the price but don't expect much more than the standard Italian fare for breakfast. A toaster was not made available in the dining room on request. The rooms are very, very small and very clean. Bathroom very small but adequate. There is a bar fridge but no tea or coffee making facilities. Staff helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel. At best a 3...”
Reviews.Author: G4Z
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star hotel. At best a 3 star. The attitude of the reception lady was arrogant and dismissive beyond belief. The room was so small we couldn't walk down either side of the bed. One side was nearly touching the wall, about 10cm gap. Ridiculous. TV didn't work so we asked reception to look at it while we were out for the day, returned 6 hrs later and nothing been done. We asked them again and eventually they came and fixed it about 8hrs after requesting. Rubbish. The breakfast experience was v intimidating, the kitchen lady was constantly staring at us and tutting when we ate anything. She acted like a prison warden. V v weird. I would strongly recommend you staying elsewhere for good value and service. 1/10

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeoMarina
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel in a very silent, green area, near the embassies. The nearest tube-station (Policliniko) is about 4 minutes by walk. The hotel is beutiful with very kind staff. Our room was wery little, but very comfortable, well-furnished. The TV was also very modern with a lot of channels - we had a Hungarian channel as well. We really enjoyed our holiday in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in quiet area, a bit out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: DanDaMan83
Reviews.Content: A nice, clean hotel with friendly staff. We had room 304 which had a huge private terrace, would definitely recommend trying to get that room. The room itself was cosy but big enough for the two of us with all our stuff, the bathroom on the other hand was quite small with limited surface space to set things down (although the size of the terrace more than made up for this!) Breakfast was limited, breads, ham, cheese, pastries, eggs, cereal and yoghurts etc, and as we were staying for a week it became rather bland, eating the same thing every day, although it hit the spot until lunch time. The hotel has a metro station within 3 mins walk and is situated two metro stops from termini train station, from which you can reach anywhere in the city. We bought a week long travel pass for 16 euro - bargain! If you don't mind not being in the heart of city life then this hotel will suit well, however I think I'd prefer to have been a little closer to the centre. Be warned - there aren't any shops or restaurants close to the hotel, there could have been but we coldn't spot any. If we wanted anything we bought it at termini (plenty of shops there) and brought it back to the hotel. Overall this is a decent hotel with friendly staff, a little out of the way but by no means inaccessible. Would I stay again? Probably not just because I'd have liked to have been closer to the action of Rome - which is truely amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Not recomended, I will never return!-check pictures!”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterRo
Reviews.Content: NOT A 4 STAR HOTEL!!! I sayed for 3 weeeks, and although I had a long stay i was given room 201 and despite all my requests to be moved, it didnt happeneed. cons: - below mediocre breakfast: if you're prepared to eat in so called 4* hotel each omlet, with a slice of ham and a slive of chesse, go for it. btw, they also have cereals. Also...be preapared to drink form plastic glasses. - room with only one bed and a small desk....2 persons dont have enough space. - room 201 HAS ANTS!!!!! if you're a ant lover, go for it...otherwise ..! - noisy...very noisy - no view - incredible small bathroom, I could not stay on the toilet...unbeliveble. - no restaurant - no bar pros: - nice employees - free parking, where you always find a plce between 7PM and 9 AM, otherwise is 1 euro/h -internet relatevely cheap, 10 euro for 24h (but you cand devide the time, you dont have to stay all those 24h in one pice), very conveninat I will definetly not go there again, one of the worst hotels i have ever stayed in and i've been enough in africa. Still, do not expect to find good hotels in rome, they do not rely on difelity, they rely on new visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: KJP0687
Reviews.Content: Very rude receptionists, unhelpful, and not friendly. They sent us on a 40 minute walk to get to a resturant that they said was 5 minutes away, and it was closed. they did not fix the broken tv, and did not connect calls to our room, even though we had the keys and were in the room. The rooms have average decoration and are not that large, and our request for a panoramic room was not given, which angered us when we found it had been vacent for atleast 2 days of our trip. Location is not ideal, it is a 10 minute to the metro, and the metro does not go to many of the sites in rome, you still have a long walk to the pantheon or trevi fountain. The garden is on the road almost and was not well kept, it was dirt and constantly disturbed by cleaners and other staff. Rooms were okay.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay, helpful staff, clean and comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: thegoodlife95
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, staff very helpful and spoke good english. Breakfast was great, rooms clean and comfortable. Not many facilities at the hotel itself, for example no bar. Would recommend short walk to a bar nearby at top of Via XX Settembre which stayed open late. If you're staying here, its a long walk to the attractions, metro is a must - only couple of minutes walk to nearest stop (ask staff) - easy to use, cheap, reliable and safe.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine29
Reviews.Content: Myself and my family stayed here for 4 nights in sept. It is a small beautiful hotel. Good size rooms we had 3 doubles my parents room had beautiful door out onto patio. Staff were really friendly with good English. Very helpful with directions, provided us with maps and recommended some lovely restaurants. breakfast was encluded and was really nice. It was a buffet so you could help yourself to everything and there was plenty to choose from. it was located about 20 mins walk from Termini the Main Train/ Bus Station but was only 2 mins walk from the Metro so location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option for Rome.”
Reviews.Author: NenitodeMadriz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this nice small hotel in Rome quite recently (2 weeks ago). I am pleased to say that it was an excellent choice. The hotel is very close to Policlinico Underground Station , just two stops from Termini train and Underground station. Staff is polite, friendly and discreet. Room size is fine, not huge but enough, clean and neat. Perhaps the entrance to the shower may be slightly narrow for big people. Breakfast was good, several things to choose. The hotel is a very nice building and my overall impression is excellent. I will clearly consider this option whenever I travel back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sammie22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel and we just can say that the staff is very nice and helpful. The rooms, like before mentioned, are small but cozy and well furnished. Everything is clean. The Metro and Tram are nearby but if you like to explore the city, you can walk to the most places of interest. Breakfast is great for Italy! But don't expect a cooked breakfast !

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: muffjk
Reviews.Content: i took my girlfriend here for her birthday and she loved it. the hotel is in a great location right beside the metro and the trams etc. the hotel is lovely rooms small but cosy and well furnished with a well stocked mini bar. the staff were really helpful and there english was quite good and they gave us a map that was really handy we used it for all of our trip. there are some really lovely restaurants in the vicinity which were lovely and good value. all in all really liked the hotel and its location it was a perfect base for exploring rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Peewee08036
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently outside the US. I was attending a business meeting in Rome and I decided to come a few days early to sight see. The acccommodations very nice. My room was a little small. I stayed in room 106. The room was clean and nicely presented. From some of the pictures I have seen on other websites, the upper rooms look a little larger. A modest breakfast was offered each day. Several restaurants are in walking distance (a block or two). Close to the subway (only two stops from Termini Station). I would recommended this hotel. I am not sure I would stay if I was bringing my kids. Natalie

Reviews.Title: “Not quite the 4 Star.”
Reviews.Author: Wetherall
Reviews.Content: 1 st Dec 2007. Just returned from a 5 day, 4 night break in Rome. The Hotel Patrizi is in an ideal location just outside the city walls in an area which contains a large number of Embassies and Italian Goverment Buildings. Very handy for the metro - Policlinico or 40 minute easy walk to the centre of Rome. Hotel provides room and breakfast only. No restaurant or bar facilities in hotel but plenty within a few minutes walk. Hotel comfortably furnished but does not come up to it's 4 star rating in terms of the small size of rooms, the bathroom fixtures and fittings are beginning to look tired, and if you have the misfortune to end up on the 2nd floor - rooms 301, 302 etc ,you may experience the overheating problem that required us to have the windows permanently open. The air conditioning did not work. We asked for a room change and were moved from 304 to 302 only to find the problems to be identical. It appears to us that if you are on a deal as we were, 4 nights for the price of three, then you get the sauna. The buffet breakfast was adequate but not that of a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “1st Class Service”
Reviews.Author: JV_01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Patrizi for 4 nights. I had some reservations after reading some of the reviews here but was pleasantly surprised, we arrived several hours earlier than expected and they were able to accommodate us even though the hotel was solidly booked. I can not speak highly enough about the staff at this hotel. This was the tail end of our European Holiday and the staff treated us like family. In particular Ricardo and Nichola were very attentative and made us feel very welcomed. I'm from Australia and can speak Italian. They spoke English well enough to understand. We got a triple room with a decent bathroom. We knew in advance that the breakfast would only be continental, so I don't know why people complain about this fact. The location is in a more quieter section of central Rome Near the English Embassy and is only 2 stops from Termini (Central Rome). Pleanty of shops and restaurants nearby. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant small hotel, spotlessly clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: thegirliesIreland
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room with a pleasant balcony, nicely decorated and spotlessly clean although rooms are small. The bathroom was tiny but perfectly functional and the shower was good. There is no bath - shower only, although this did not concern us. Breakfast is a basic continental selection but what more do you require when on holiday? Staff spoke varying degrees of English but those with good english were more than helpful. Overall we had a very pleasant stay and despite reading several poor reviews of this hotel we found our experience much more positive.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: jedisith
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say about this hotel, if I can call it one. First of all they said they only had one double room available even though we had booked 2 and had documentation to prove it. It was only when I threatened to ring my travel agent that they suddenly had another room (which turned out to be the dreaded 201), and the previous reviewer is right in what he says. We asked for another room but was told that the hotel was fully booked. We went out for a walk and when we returned we found that the 1st room (G02) had ants in the bathroom. When I complained i was told that the manager would be down to see me but she never arrived and left the concierge who barely spoke english to deal with me. I asked to be movd to another room but again was told that there were no othr rooms available. I then rang my travel agent who moved us to another hotel (SAVOY). When the concierge found out about this suddenly another room was available. At this stage we had enough and moved hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff were unfriendly and unwelcoming. It is not in the great location as it claims to be. I have stayed in many hotels in both europe and US and would easily say that this is the worst ever!!!! How this got a 4 star rating is beyond belief

Reviews.Title: “this hotel [s**s]!”
Reviews.Author: wanderingdesi
Reviews.Content: i have just returned from rome. I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. I was given the smallest room(room 201) they had available. The bathroom is smaller than my walk in closet at home. the shower handle for hot water was missing. There is barely any light in the room and the remote for the television did not work. I don't have a clue as to why this place has a four star rating. I arrived early (11:00) and i was told that they had nothing available since the check in time is 2:00 p.m. i was told to leave my suitcase in the hallway. the concierge was extremely rude. Please find somewhere else to stay in rome.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: druidware
Reviews.Content: The decor is the best thing I could say about this Hotel. The room allocated was extremely small, only allowing us to get into one side of the bed! And when your head can touch the wall when you need to sit on the WC, then that indicates small as far as I'm concerned. All but one of the reception staff were arrogant and rude/gruff. There is no shuttle service at all, you would need to taxi to the termini or drag your suitcases to the nearest metro to get to the termini, then catch the shuttle bus from the termini to the airport. There is no laundry service. The buffet was all cold food for breakfast. All in all I would certainly not rate this hotel as 4 star, more like a 2 star, due to the lack of facilities. I would recommend staying closer to the attractions, and paying a little extra.

Reviews.Title: “Get Soemwhere Closer for the same price”
Reviews.Author: Docalla
Reviews.Content: On arriving to Italy I stayed in another hotel in Rome on via National then I travelled around Italy and stayed here for one night before I flew home. The first Rome hotel was great and in comparison I was disappointed with the Villa Patrizi Hotel. I was put in a room on the ground floor beside reception with a very loud air conditioning unit just outside the room window. And the air conditioning in the room itself was the poorest I experience in Italy. Basically this hotel is fine but you will get cheaper and nicer closer to the centre or Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Welcoming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BucksWanderers
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the many good things said about this hotel. It is quiet, convenient, clean and the staff could not be more plesant or helpful. OK, the rooms might not be as large as you might expect in a 4*, but for the long weekend we stayed, our room was more than adequate. Highly recommended and excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great”
Reviews.Author: jhjhjhjhjh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Villa Patrizzi and was very impressed. Although the rooms are on the small side, it was spotlessly clean at all times. Staff at the reception were very helpful and would do anything to help. Hotel location is excellent position.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place.”
Reviews.Author: m9115
Reviews.Content: We had a nice quad room, not big but ok for the family. Very convient to the underground to the inner city. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. All the places we stayed in Europe had english CNN or BBC but this place did not. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A nice find - peaceful area - lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: hemofherdress
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we needed and more. It is located in a quiet area of Rome, outside the city walls away from the hustle and bustle of the tourist area. It is a 15 minute walk from Termini, which was extremely convenient. The area is in a business district, so the clientele weren’t loud and the reception was extremely helpful and kind. There is also a pleasant shopping area near the villa, which is a nice alternative to the city centre and you really get a feel of local Rome, as opposed to the tourist face. Seeing as this hotel is a converted villa, the rooms are a little smaller than an average hotel, but the sacrifice is small, for the surroundings and just general pleasantness of the place. They served a traditional Roman breakfast, with the odd anglicised extra (i.e. tea, cereal, eggs, etc. – these are not common foods for breakfast in Rome, as the average Roman will just have a café for breakfast and that is all, with the odd bread roll. Lunch is their main meal). The rooms provide en suite showers and toiletries. There is of course air conditioning, a television and mini-bar. The terraces provide a nice place to rest and relax. The hotel was very clean and had no odour problem. I couldn’t recommend this place enough. We stayed there for two full weeks, with not one complaint. In fact the reception was just so brilliant in helping us out with advice and transfers to the airport, etc. – one night they even ordered in pizza from their local pizza restaurant for us and had it ordered up, when we didn’t want to go out. It cost us very little for the take away. Wonderful staff, nice atmosphere, great area!

HotelInfo.Name: Villa Patrizi
HotelInfo.Address: Via di Villa Patrizi 20, 00161 Rome, Italy
